title: How to Find out if Your Cheese Is Vegetarian

steps.headline: Research and read your labels.
steps.description: Some common listings for animal ingredients used in the production cheese are enzymes, rennet, and whey, but these can come from a number of sources. Microbial enzymes are manmade and derived from harmless mold, and other enzymes are made from vegetables. Read your label and look for specific words like "animal" or "non-animal".

steps.headline: Check the company website.
steps.description: Many people call companies for nutrition information and common questions are often answered in the FAQ area of the company's official website.

steps.headline: Call the company or distributor.
steps.description: If you are trying to find out about the cheese in a product, like in frozen pizza, you may have to call the company and ask for information about their cheese distributor. Not all companies make their own cheese and they may not be the best source of specific nutrition details.

steps.headline: Explain your question clearly.
steps.description: The common person doesn't know a lot about the science of food, so you may have to explain your question to the person you contact or ask for someone in the company's nutrition or development department.

steps.headline: Find your favorite alternatives.
steps.description: Once you find out which cheese brands are vegetarian and which are not, help yourself to a few samples. It will be easier to avoid cheese that isn't vegetarian if you find a delicious alternative source.

text: Research and read your labels. Some common listings for animal ingredients used in the production cheese are enzymes, rennet, and whey, but these can come from a number of sources. Microbial enzymes are manmade and derived from harmless mold, and other enzymes are made from vegetables. Read your label and look for specific words like "animal" or "non-animal". Check the company website. Many people call companies for nutrition information and common questions are often answered in the FAQ area of the company's official website. Call the company or distributor. If you are trying to find out about the cheese in a product, like in frozen pizza, you may have to call the company and ask for information about their cheese distributor. Not all companies make their own cheese and they may not be the best source of specific nutrition details. Explain your question clearly. The common person doesn't know a lot about the science of food, so you may have to explain your question to the person you contact or ask for someone in the company's nutrition or development department. Find your favorite alternatives. Once you find out which cheese brands are vegetarian and which are not, help yourself to a few samples. It will be easier to avoid cheese that isn't vegetarian if you find a delicious alternative source.
